Quotes: When men and woman die, as poets sung, his heart's the last part moves, her last, the tongue.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Joyce is a poet and also an elephantine pedant.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: My favourite poem is the one that starts 'Thirty days hath September' because it actually tells you something.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: Poets utter great and wise things which they do not themselves understand.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood.
Author: T S Eliot
